description: Zscaler says that today's rumors it was breached are false after a threat actor claimed to be selling access to one of the "largest cyber security companies." [...]
title: Zscaler says it was not hacked after rumors circulate online

description: The University System of Georgia (USG) is sending data breach notifications to 800,000 individuals whose data was exposed in the 2023 Clop MOVEit attacks. [...]
title: University System of Georgia: 800K exposed in 2023 MOVEit attack

description: ​Ascension, one of the largest private healthcare systems in the United States, has taken some of its systems offline to investigate what it describes as a "cyber security event." [...]
title: Ascension healthcare takes systems offline after cyberattack

description: OpenAI and Stack Overflow recently teamed up to improve AI models. OpenAI will have access to Stack Overflow's API and feedback from developers. In return, OpenAI will link to Stack Overflow's content in ChatGPT. [...]
title: Stack Overflow suspends user for editing posts in OpenAI protest

description: F5 has fixed two high-severity BIG-IP Next Central Manager vulnerabilities, which can be exploited to gain admin control and create rogue accounts on any managed assets. [...]
title: New BIG-IP Next Central Manager bugs allow device takeover

description: The FBI warned retail companies in the United States that a financially motivated hacking group has been targeting employees in their gift card departments in phishing attacks since at least January 2024. [...]
title: FBI warns of gift card fraud ring targeting retail companies

description: The LockBit ransomware gang has claimed responsibility for a disruptive cyberattack on the City of Wichita, which has forced the City's authorities to shut down IT systems used for online bill payment, including court fines, water bills, and public transportation. [...]
title: City of Wichita breach claimed by LockBit ransomware gang

description: Microsoft has confirmed that last month's Windows Server security updates may also cause domain controller reboots after the Local Security Authority Subsystem Service (LSASS) process crashes. [...]
title: Microsoft: April Windows Server updates also cause crashes, reboots

description: A massive network of 75,000 fake online shops called 'BogusBazaar' tricked over 850,000 people in the US and Europe into making purchases, allowing the criminals to steal credit card information and attempt to process an estimated $50 million in fake orders. [...]
title: Massive webshop fraud ring steals credit cards from 850,000 people
